alert.note: Alert for Butte, Blackfoot Region; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 12:11AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Missoula and northern Granite Counties through 115 AM MDT... At 1209 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles south of Seeley Lake to 8 miles northwest of Drummond. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less due to heavy rainfall SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility and ponding of water could result in hazardous driving conditions along Highway 200 and Interstate 90. Travel with care. Locations impacted include... Garnet, Greenough and Bearmouth. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 140 and 147. Highway 200 E between mile markers 19 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Butte, Blackfoot Region; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
